intro: Randia monantha, commonly known as the white randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Randia monantha is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
